Talking Points
1.Nature’s Fyndis a new vegan foods company made 
with Fy.
•Fyis a nutritional fungi protein.
•Fyis a complete, vegan protein with all 20 
essential amino acids.
2.Our Meatless Breakfast Patties have 75% less fat than 
traditional pork sausage.
3.Our Dairy-Free Cream Cheese is nut-free, soy-free and 
gluten-free.
4.Fyis fungi-based and is made through a fermentation 
process -similar tohow sourdough bread is made with 
a sourdough starter.
5.Fyis better for the environment. At scale, Fyuses 99% 
less water, and emits 94% fewer greenhouse gases 
than traditional agriculture.

Equipment & Supplies NeededEvent Kit Contents (Shipped to Store)
•Gloves  –REQUIRED
•Sneeze Guard –REQUIRED for Cooking Demos
•Face Mask –SEE STORE POLICY
•Metal Tray
•Skillet
•Bowl of Ice
•Cutting Board / Knife
•Sample Cups
•Forks
•Fact Cards
•Coupons
Look for the event kit in the Demo Zone or ask a Store Team 
Leader. It should have a bright green label stating “Hold for 
Interactions Demo”
Goal: Sell 15 units of product if stock is available
PRODUCT ALLOWANCE: $35

1.Write product name and price on chalkboard neatly.
2.[Meatless Breakfast Patties]
•Retrieve and purchase any 365 brandcooking oil from the store shelves to use for cooking.
•Pre-heat skillet over medium heat and generously coat the skillet with oil.
•Cook meatless patties for 2-3 minutes on one side.
•Flip patties and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
•Only cook patties until very lightly browned (no hard crusting) –do not overcook.
•Once fully cooked, cut each cooked patty into quarters and serve in sample cups.
3.[Dairy-Free Cream Cheese]
•Retrieve and purchase any brand of Bagel Chipsto use for sampling.
•Spread about 1 tsp of cream cheese on a bagel chip and serve on a napkin. 
4.Place sample on the metal tray for customer to take. Do not hand sample directly to customer. Do not 
prepare samples ahead of time!
5.Take note of customer comments about the product (likes, dislikes, etc.) to submit in your recap
6.Save each empty package to purchase at the end of your shift.
1.Unplug any appliances used and let them cool if needed.
2.Clean and sanitize all demo equipment & supplies, let dry then return to demo cabinet.
3.Refer to Event Procedures for detailed cleaning instructions & FAQ’s.
4.Clean and sanitize the demo cart and return to demo zone.
•Do not leave anything in the demo cart
5.At the end of your shift, you will purchase the featured products with a maximum spending limitof $35.
•Make sure to select DEBITwhen making purchases
•Do not exceed the maximum spending limit
6.Make sure to save all receipts and submit them with your Event Receipt Form at the end of your shift.
7.If you’ve reached your maximum spending limit, spend the remaining time on your shift performing an 
educational demo.
